resume.mission: I am a seasoned UX developer and designer. I live and die by user-centered application design and pragmatic coding practices. I have a soft spot for team building, mentoring, and UX/UI architecture. I am a bit of a mad scientist.
resume.skills: I know my way around user focused design, information architecture, UI performance, HTML5, CSS3 and a few javascript frameworks. I've built things using Angular, Wordpress, Drupal, using tools like Grunt, Bower, Powershell, Sublime text, Node.  Most of all, I like solving problems.
resume.quote: Developing people, process and products are my passion. I love working closer to the top of the stack. I've lead enterprise UI teams with a lean startup mentality. I've had a couple years of leadership and UI architecture under my belt. I like what those things have done to my brain.

timeline.description: I helped implement semantic, user-centered front end implementations for Petsmart, Radio Shack, GNC, Adidas, Ralph Lauren, and Timberland. I was involved in interviewing, mentoring and training new developers in web standards, modular CSS approaches and emerging browser technologies. I also led an internal tools and prototyping team utilizing a variety of technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, Responsive Web Design, Javascript, LESS, Gruntjs, Angularjs, jQuery/UI, Jstl, CakePHP.

I provided my clients an array of services including project planning, visual design, and rapid HTML, CSS, and JS based theme development for a variety of open source content management and ecommerce platforms (Drupal, Ubercart, CubeCart, Wordpress, and Textpattern).

I provided Webcore with a number of Web development and consulting services including visual design, and HTML, CSS, JavaScript based theme development for a variety of CMS platforms and even broader base of clients.
Focused largely on Wordpress theme development, I worked within a small team of cross discipline developers and designers to deliver dynamic web projects for a wide variety of clients and industries.
